intro: Xanthostemon youngii, commonly known as the young's xanthostemon, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to northern Australia, particularly found in the Northern Territory and Queensland. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. This species is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
